author: Sara Morosi
title: WSJ. Magazine Contributors: March Women’s 2018
text:
ROBERT POLIDORI & JOSHUA LEVINE Hidden Figures
When writer Joshua Levine (right) went to Iran to report on its burgeoning art scene, it was his first visit to the country. “I’ll never forget the trip. You really felt that you had entered another world, much of which is very attractive,” says Levine. “It gives me a lot of hope for Iran. It has so much to offer that is not recognized.” Meeting gallery directors, curators, collectors and artists, Levine experienced the art world’s many dimensions. “I came to the conclusion...
